title: BBC Local Live: Merseyside and west Cheshire on Monday 16 January 2017 - BBC News
summary: cilla black statue unveiled as cavern club celebrates 60th anniversary .
arrests over robbery of ex-liverpool owner david moores .
liverpool 'likely ' to miss disabled fans standards deadline .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates from merseyside and west cheshire have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on tuesday with more of the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: weather : largely dry and mild
text: tonight will start largely dry and cloudy , with hill fog .
there will be some rain in the north near southport later but it will stay mild and frost free .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cilla black statue unveiled as cavern club celebrates 60 years
text: a life-sized bronze statue of cilla black has been unveiled outside liverpool 's cavern club as the venue celebrates its 60th anniversary .
the club , credited with launching the career of the beatles , opened its doors on 16 january 1957 as a jazz cellar .
crowds gathered in mathew street to see the sculpture which shows a young cilla performing one of her early songs .
the tv celebrity and 1960s singing star , who died in 2015 , started work as a cloakroom attendant at the club .

documents.title: plan for new a-level centre in knowsley , council says
text: knowsley council is planning to create a new a-level centre to ensure students can stay in the borough to study for the qualification .
it comes after closure of the area 's only sixth form offering the qualification - halewood academy - was approved by the government in june .
in a recent meeting with the department for education ( dfe ) , knowsley 's six secondary schools `` spoke out in support of a centralised a-level centre '' , a council spokeswoman said .
the council will now put together `` a detailed case '' to secure funding , which will take up to four months .
if the plan is given the go-ahead , it is expected to take about three years to before a new centre would be ready .

both the dfe and the education funding agency - which provides all the funding for a-level provision nationally - agreed with us that there is a gap in provision in our borough , and both have said that they will work positively with us to address this issue . ''

documents.title: pizza takeaway driver jailed for sex offences
text: a 24-year-old man from skelmersdale has been jailed for inciting a girl to engage in sexual activity , police say .
police said pizza takeaway driver samuel brown , of glebe road , sent a 15-year-old girl dozens of messages of a sexual nature by phone and social media between july and december 2015 .
he regularly asked her to go on pizza deliveries with him `` in the hope she would engage in sexual activity '' , police said .
brown was sentenced to 18 months in prison at liverpool crown court .
he was also issued with a restraining order to not contact the victim , a sexual harm prevention order and made to sign the sex offenders ' register , each for 10 years .

documents.title: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire
text: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire

documents.title: matip could miss six more games
text: liverpool defender joel matip could miss a further six matches because of confusion about his international clearance .
matip did not want to play for cameroon after he was named in the preliminary squad for the africa cup of nations .
matip , who has made 14 appearances for the reds this season , last played for cameroon in september 2015 .
fifa says that without cameroon 's permission , matip , 25 , can not play for the reds until the end of their participation in the tournament .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: two southport care homes rated inadequate ' by health watchdog
text: two care homes in southport have been rated `` inadequate '' , following inspections by the care quality commission .
manchester house nursing home and community care direct have been criticised for standards of safety and poor management .
both services have been placed in special measures , which means they must make significant improvements - or risk losing their registration .

documents.title: four teenagers attacked by gang of youths armed with baseball bats in prenton
text: police are appealing for witnesses after four teenage boys were allegedly assaulted by a group of around 20 youths in prenton , wirral on saturday .
author: Wirral Globe

documents.title: newborn lambs given oxygen after cheshire barn fire
text: two newborn lambs and their mum were given oxygen by firefighters after a fire at a barn in cheshire .
fire crews were called to higher wych road in malpas to reports of a small fire in the early hours of sunday morning .
a ewe had just given birth to two lambs and was unable to move .
the ewe and the offspring were given oxygen using special animal masks to help them recover .

documents.title: lorry driver from st helens dies in m6 crash
text: a 48-year-old lorry driver from st helens has died after a crash on the m6 in lancashire .
author: St Helens Star

documents.title: weather : dull and drizzly afternoon
text: a dull and cloudy afternoon with drizzly spells .
some mist in places .
highs of 10c .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: widnes asylum hostel plans to be discussed
text: councillors in halton will meet later to discuss controversial plans to turn a former care home in widnes into a hostel for up to 120 asylum seekers .
the 60-bed lilycross home on wilmere lane had its licence withdrawn in october after care quality commission inspectors branded it inadequate .
critics , including the neighbouring st helens and local parish councils , say it does n't fit with local development plans .
more than 700 people have signed petitions opposing the idea .

documents.title: creative commuters who enjoy the ride
text: some creative commuters are occupying their travelling hours with a productive pastime .
it takes lindsey farquhar three hours a day to travel to and from liverpool .
she paints , crochets and makes jewellery which she posts on her crafty commuter facebook page .
`` the crafty commuter started in november 2014 when i missed the early train to work so had time to wait for the next one , '' said the 42-year-old who works for a housing association .
`` so i bought a crochet magazine with free wool and crochet hooks at the station just on a whim .
`` but once i started my crafty commute , i arrived at work much more relaxed and feeling like i 'd accomplished something creative already before i even got into work .
i loved it .
`` i crochet bobble hats and boot toppers in the winter and i make wire-wrapped jewellery when it gets warmer .
wire is my summer version of wool , you see .
`` then i started drawing and painting .
i put together a little travel kit that i could take on the train . ''

documents.title: david moores : arrests over robbery of ex-liverpool owner
text: police investigating an attack on former liverpool owner david moores during a robbery at his home in west lancashire have arrested five people .
mr moores , 69 , was badly beaten by two men who forced their way into his house in halsall in march .
three men , aged 30 , 34 and 39 , from liverpool were arrested for conspiracy to commit robbery and released on bail , lancashire police said .
a man , 38 , from widnes was held for attempting to pervert the course of justice and was also released on bail .
a 29-year-old woman from liverpool , who was arrested on sus of handling stolen goods and money laundering , has been released without charge ,

documents.title: football : wallace signs permanent tranmere deal
text: james wallace has signed a permanent 18-month deal with national league side tranmere rovers after a successful loan spell from sheffield united .
the 25-year-old midfielder previously made 60 appearances for rovers between 2012 and 2014 and played under tranmere boss micky mellon during a loan spell at shrewsbury last season .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: listen again : celebrating 60 years of the cavern
text: the cavern in liverpool is celebrating its 60th anniversary today and bbc radio merseyside has been broadcasting live from deep in the depths of the world-famous club in mathew street .
tony snell speaks to the owners and directors and find out once for all why the debate still rages about `` where was the original cavern ?
what happened to it ?
or are we standing in it ?
hear about the new cilla black statue which was unveiled in the city today as well as live performances from the voice star and resident musician callum mac .
listen again : tony snell in the morning - live from the cavern club

documents.title: boys - one as young as 12 - bailed after scrambler bike crash that left teen in hospital
text: two boys - one as young as 12 - have been bailed after police quizzed them over a scrambler bike crash that left a girl with a serious head injury .
author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: cilla black statue unveiled outside cavern club for 60th anniversary
text: a statue of liverpool singer and tv presenter cilla black has been unveiled outside the cavern club on mathew street this morning .
the unveiling kicked off a day of celebrations as the world famous club celebrates its 60th birthday .
cilla first worked at the venue as a cloakroom girl - before going on to launch a huge successful signing career of her own .
the life-sized statue features images from the singer and tv presenter 's life and was created by artists emma rodgers and andy edwards .
it was commissioned by her sons robert , ben and jack who decided to back the idea after being moved by the response from the city following cilla 's death in august 2015 .

documents.title: cilla black statue unveiled in liverpool
text: a statue of the late cilla black has been unveiled outside liverpool 's cavern club this morning - as the venue celebrates its 60th birthday .
crowds gathered in mathew street for the unveiling of the bronze sculpture which shows a young cilla performing one of her early songs .
it was commissioned by her sons robert , ben and jack who decided to back the idea after being moved by the response from the city following cilla 's death in august 2015 .
born in liverpool as priscilla maria veronica white , she started out as a cloakroom girl at the famous venue , before going on to launch a memorable singing career herself .
her son robert says it `` feels special to have a permanent memorial to her '' .

documents.title: liverpool 's world famous cavern club marks 60 years
text: the cavern club in liverpool is celebrating its 60th anniversary today with a programme of special events .
celebrations start at 11:00 with the unveiling of a life-sized cilla black statue in mathew street and there is live music throughout the day at the cavern pub .

documents.title: football : premier league clubs may face sanctions over lack of improvement
text: liverpool has been named as one of four premier league football clubs which is likely to miss a deadline for improving standards for disabled fans .
several clubs are likely to miss a deadline on meeting basic standards .
the culture , media and sport select committee says it is unconvinced the league would punish clubs itself .
the committee has warned clubs that fail to meet the august deadline to become compliant could be fined , and even have points deducted .
the premier league says it is `` working extremely hard '' on access .
author: BBC Sport

the bronze sculpture will de her performing one of her early songs .
her son robert said the family decided to back the idea , after being moved by the response from the city following cilla 's death in august 2015 .

documents.title: football : we bettered 'long-ball ' united - klopp
text: liverpool manager jurgen klopp said that manchester united had to resort to `` wild '' long-ball football in a feisty draw at old trafford .
united striker zlatan ibrahimovic 's header cancelled out james milner 's penalty at old trafford , leaving liverpool without a win in four games .
klopp said : `` they play long balls in a wild game .
we played the better football and had the better plan . ''
united counterpart jose mourinho said : `` we attacked and liverpool were the team that defended . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cavern club celebrates 60th anniversary
text: celebrations are being held in liverpool today as the cavern club marks its 60th anniversary .
one of the most famous music venues in the world , the club opened its doors in mathew street on the 16 january 1957 .
it was initially a jazz cellar , but became synonymous with merseybeat .
the beatles first performed there in 1961 and established themselves as the cavern club 's signature act going on to play the venue almost 300 times .
listen : bbc radio merseyside 's tony snell broadcasts live from the cavern club

documents.title: football : clinical everton put four past man city
text: everton stun manchester city with a superb performance at goodison park to leave pep guardiola 's side 10 points off the top spot .
the toffees willingly soaked up 71 % of city possession but restricted guardiola 's side to few chances and scored with four of just six attempts at goal .
romelu lukaku coolly side-footed in a kevin mirallas cut-back and the belgium internationals combined again after the break , mirallas drilling lukaku 's through-ball across the keeper .

tom davies sent goodison park into raptures on just his second league start by dinking a third over claudio bravo and £ 11m debutant ademola lookman fired between the legs of the keeper in injury time .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: travel : rail replacement bus service between birkenhead and liverpool
text: there is no service on merseyrail between birkenhead central and liverpool lime street , and between birkenhead north and liverpool lime street .
replacement bus services are running at liverpool moorfields , at liverpool lime street and between birkenhead central and birkenhead north .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: hello from liverpool , i 'm here with all your news , sport , travel and weather updates from across merseyside and west cheshire today .
if you 've got a story you 'd like me to hear about or a photograph you 'd like to share , you can contact me on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Jenny Coleman
Reporter, BBC Local Live
